definition: to put in time and energy/to concentrate one's efforts
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: In recent years, I do park in the ink area, now in its characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，我园在水墨画方面下工夫，现已初具特色。

sentences.english: It's impossible to learn a foreign language without working hard at it.
sentences.chinese: 不下工夫就能学会外语是不可能的。

sentences.english: The teacher asked his students to labour at obligatory courses.
sentences.chinese: 老师要求学生在必修课上多下工夫。

sentences.english: Wujing indicated that directs the first movie regarding oneself, he works hard.
sentences.chinese: 吴京表示，对于自己执导的首部电影，他非常下工夫。

sentences.english: Whether the language is leamt quickly or slow-ly, it is hard work.
sentences.chinese: 语言学的快也好慢也好，是要下工夫的。

sentences.english: By midafternoon, it’s clear that more is needed.
sentences.chinese: 到了下午3时左右，显然还需要多下工夫。

definition: to perfect sth that is already outstanding (idiom); constantly improving
diligent/industrious (in one's studies)/to study hard/to make great effort
to spend a great deal of time and effort/(of a task) demanding/exacting
to take up time/to spend time
